node.title: 'It's sad to know that hatred still exists': Iwi mourns loss of pouwhenua smashed to pieces in Lyttelton
node.description: "The way that it was destroyed is certainly very saddening."
node.content: ["Te Hap\u016b o Ng\u0101ti Wheke in Canterbury is mourning the loss of an intricate carving after it was vandalised.\u00a0", "The piece called K\u014dauau o T\u0101ne Whakapiripiri was smashed to pieces and police want to talk to anyone with information about it.\u00a0", "The pou was carved by local M\u0101ori and was gifted to Christchurch City Council.", "There was an outpouring of aroha from the Rapaki community.\u00a0", "\"It's sad; I think it represents a lot for the people in the area, the people who live in Rapaki,\" said resident Giulio Sturla.", "As they mourn the loss of K\u014dauau o T\u0101ne Whakapiripiri, smashed to pieces by vandals.", "Caine Tauwhare carved the pouwhenua himself.", "\"[I] split it apart and hollowed it out and turned it into a wind instrument into a koauau which is a type of flute,\" he explained.", "The easterly wind whistled through it, signifying the karanga of manuhiri (visitors) that used to take place at \u014ct\u016bherekio. It's now little more than a plinth.\u00a0", "\"It's really sad to know that that type of hatred still exists here, especially with all the grief that's happened in Christchurch over the last couple of years,\" Tauwhare said.", "\"The way that it was destroyed is certainly very saddening.\"", "K\u014dauau o T\u0101ne Whakapiripiri is one of two pou that were blessed in the Lyttelton area in 2012.", "\u014chinehou still stands tall at Sutton Reserve, but the remains of the other have now been returned to Rapaki Marae.\u00a0", "Te Hap\u016b o Ng\u0101ti Wheke chair Manaia Rehu says the pou was created with aroha for all to appreciate. He says while Ng\u0101ti Wheke is saddened by this act of vandalism, it's calling for calm.", "\"Take inspiration from ancestors, from Parihaka - they were imprisoned here in this harbour - and their philosophy of love,\" said Tauwhare."]
